title: Brace - Shock Tower (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content: Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the cabin intake duct. See Duct - Air Intake (Remove and Replace) .
Remove LV power. See LV Battery (Remove and Install) .

Use a clip pry tool to release the
            clips (x4) that attach the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket.

Release the connector locking tab, and
            then disconnect the HVIL connector near the LH front strut tower. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note DO NOT push down on the red locking tab. Pull
              the tab away from the connector until the connector is unlocked, and then continue
              pulling to release the connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Pick Miniature Soft Grip, 90
                        degree tip, 6 in

Release the connector locking tab,
            then disconnect the A/C logic electrical connector from the A/C compressor. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note DO NOT push down on the red locking tab. Pull
              the tab away from the connector until the connector is unlocked, and then continue
              pulling to release the connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Pick Miniature Soft Grip, 90
                        degree tip, 6 in

Use a clip pry tool to release the
            retaining clip that attaches the A/C compressor logic harness to the A/C compressor HV
            harness bracket.

Remove the bolt that attaches the
            ground strap to the A/C compressor, and then set the ground strap aside. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T25 socket

Use a clip pry tool to release the
            clip that attaches the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket.

Remove the retaining clips (x5) that
            attach the A/C compressor HV harness to the shock tower brace. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Pull upward on the clip to assist with removal. Do not pull
              upward on the HV cable.

Place a fender cover (1115212-00-A) on
            the front underhood storage unit reinforcement beam to prevent damage to other
            components.

With an assistant, remove the bolts
            (x2) that attach the A/C compressor assembly to the strut tower brace, and then
            carefully maneuver the assembly towards the front of the vehicle, under the strut tower
            support brace. Rest the A/C compressor assembly on the front underhood storage unit
            reinforcement beam. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Do not rest the A/C
              compressor on the HV connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

Secure the supermanifold assembly with  bungee cords. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Install bungee cord to RH hood strut bracket. Route bungee cord around accumulator
              housing and secure to the RH body side. Do not secure bungee cord around coolant pumps
              or plastic housing on supermanifold. Use a mirror as needed to visual check bungee
              cord around accumulator housing.

Remove the bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

Remove the LH and RH bolts (x4) that attach the shock tower brace to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

Remove the LH and RH outer bolts (x2) that attach the shock tower brace to the body,
            and then remove the shock tower brace from the vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the ground strap to the A/C compressor
Bolts (x2) that attach the A/C compressor assembly to the brace
Bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace
The LH and RH bolts (x4) that attach the shock tower brace to the body
The LH and RH outer bolts that attach the shock tower brace to the body

llm_summary_text:
Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) . Remove the cabin intake duct. See Duct - Air Intake (Remove and Replace) . Remove LV power. See LV Battery (Remove and Install) . Use a clip pry tool to release the
            clips (x4) that attach the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket. Release the connector locking tab, and
            then disconnect the HVIL connector near the LH front strut tower. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note DO NOT push down on the red locking tab. Pull
              the tab away from the connector until the connector is unlocked, and then continue
              pulling to release the connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Pick Miniature Soft Grip, 90
                        degree tip, 6 in Release the connector locking tab,
            then disconnect the A/C logic electrical connector from the A/C compressor. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note DO NOT push down on the red locking tab. Pull
              the tab away from the connector until the connector is unlocked, and then continue
              pulling to release the connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Pick Miniature Soft Grip, 90
                        degree tip, 6 in Use a clip pry tool to release the
            retaining clip that attaches the A/C compressor logic harness to the A/C compressor HV
            harness bracket. Remove the bolt that attaches the
            ground strap to the A/C compressor, and then set the ground strap aside. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T25 socket Use a clip pry tool to release the
            clip that attaches the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket. Remove the retaining clips (x5) that
            attach the A/C compressor HV harness to the shock tower brace. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Pull upward on the clip to assist with removal. Do not pull
              upward on the HV cable. Place a fender cover (1115212-00-A) on
            the front underhood storage unit reinforcement beam to prevent damage to other
            components. With an assistant, remove the bolts
            (x2) that attach the A/C compressor assembly to the strut tower brace, and then
            carefully maneuver the assembly towards the front of the vehicle, under the strut tower
            support brace. Rest the A/C compressor assembly on the front underhood storage unit
            reinforcement beam. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Do not rest the A/C
              compressor on the HV connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Secure the supermanifold assembly with  bungee cords. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Install bungee cord to RH hood strut bracket. Route bungee cord around accumulator
              housing and secure to the RH body side. Do not secure bungee cord around coolant pumps
              or plastic housing on supermanifold. Use a mirror as needed to visual check bungee
              cord around accumulator housing. Remove the bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Remove the LH and RH bolts (x4) that attach the shock tower brace to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Remove the LH and RH outer bolts (x2) that attach the shock tower brace to the body,
            and then remove the shock tower brace from the vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket

title: Cowl Screen Bracket (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content: Remove the cowl screen panel. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the positive jumper post cap.

Remove the stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl
                        screen bracket. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: External Torx E5

Remove the bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

Release the tabs (x2) that attach the cowl screen bracket to the vehicle,
                        and then remove it from the vehicle.

specifications.description:
Stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl screen
              bracket
Bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body

llm_summary_text:
Remove the cowl screen panel. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) . Remove the positive jumper post cap. Remove the stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl
                        screen bracket. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: External Torx E5 Remove the bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Release the tabs (x2) that attach the cowl screen bracket to the vehicle,
                        and then remove it from the vehicle.

title: Fem Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content: Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) .
Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) .

Remove the front lightbar assembly.
            See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) .
Remove the LH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install) .

Remove the front fascia assembly from
            the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not separate the valance, the
              grille and the harness from the front fascia.

Disconnect the cooling fan
            connector.

Disconnect the LH FEM harness
            connector.

Disconnect the LH front pedestrian
            protection pressure tube sensor. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not push down on the red tab.
              Pull it to disengage the lock, and then pull it again to release the connector.

Release the harness clip from the LH
            crush can.

Release the harness clip from the
            FEM.

Release 4 of the LH front wheel liner
            clips.

Partially remove the LH front wheel
            liner.

Release the LH front wheel speed
            sensor harness clips (x2) from the body.

Disconnect the LH Front wheel speed
            sensor connector.

Remove the FEM bracket LH crash
            accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace) .

Disconnect the LH headlamp
            connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Pull the tab to disengage the lock
              mechanism, and then pull it again to release the connector. Do not press down on the
              tab.

Release the clip that attaches the
            front harness to the LH FEM bracket assembly.

Remove the harness from the LH FEM
            bracket assembly.

Remove the bolts (x3) that attach the
            LH FEM bracket assembly to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

Remove the bolt that attaches the FEM
            bracket to the LH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

Remove the bolt that attaches the LH
            FEM bracket assembly to the FEM, and then remove the LH FEM bracket assembly from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension

specifications.description: Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the body
Bolts that attach the FEM bracket to the front fender
Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the FEM

title: Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content: Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) .
Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) .

Remove the front lightbar assembly.
            See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) .
Remove the RH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install) .

Remove the front fascia assembly from
            the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not separate the valance, the
              grille and the harness from the front fascia.

Disconnect the RH FEM harness
            connector.

Disconnect the RH front pedestrian
            protection pressure tube sensor. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not push down on the red tab.
              Pull it to disengage the lock, and then pull it again to release the connector.

Release the harness clips (x2) from
            the RH headlamp.

Release the harness clip from the RH
            crush can.

Release 4 of the RH front wheel liner
            clips.

Partially remove the RH front wheel
            liner.

Release the RH front wheel speed
            sensor harness clips (x2) from the body.

Disconnect the RH front wheel speed
            sensor connector.

Remove the FEM bracket RH crash
            accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace) .

Disconnect the RH headlamp
            connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Pull the tab to disengage the lock
              mechanism, and then pull it again to release the connector. Do not press down on the
              tab.

Release the harness clip from the
            FEM.

Release the front harness clip from
            the RH FEM bracket assembly.

Remove the harness from the RH FEM
            bracket assembly.

Remove the bolts (x3) that attach the
            RH FEM bracket assembly to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

Remove the bolt that attaches the FEM
            bracket to the RH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

Remove the bolt that attaches the RH
            FEM bracket assembly to the FEM, and then remove the RH FEM bracket assembly from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension

Bolts that attach the FEM bracket to the front fender

title: Fender - LH (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content:
Open the LH front door and lower the
            LH front window.
Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) .
Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) .

Remove the front fascia assembly. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to separate the valance, the front fascia harness and the grille from the
              front fascia assembly.
Remove the LH headlamp. See Headlamp Assembly - LH (Remove and Replace) .

Remove the LH fascia side bracket from
            fender. See Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) .

Disconnect the cowl screen from the LH
            carrier bracket.

Remove the bolts (x5) that attach the
            LH front fender bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

Remove the nuts (x2) that attach the LH lower front fender bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

Disconnect the side repeater
            connectors (x2).

Remove the LH front fender assembly
            from the vehicle.

Release the clip and tabs (x2) to
            remove the LH side repeater. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Press to release the clip.

Remove the frunk fender clips (x3)
            from the LH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Replace any damaged clip.

Release the clips (x2) to remove the
            headlamp rubber grommet from the LH front fender.

specifications.description:
Bolts (x5) and nuts (x2) that attach the LH front fender bracket to
              the body

llm_summary_text:
Open the LH front door and lower the
            LH front window. Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) . Remove the front fascia assembly. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to separate the valance, the front fascia harness and the grille from the
              front fascia assembly. Remove the LH headlamp. See Headlamp Assembly - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH fascia side bracket from
            fender. See Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the cowl screen from the LH
            carrier bracket. Remove the bolts (x5) that attach the
            LH front fender bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the nuts (x2) that attach the LH lower front fender bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Disconnect the side repeater
            connectors (x2). Remove the LH front fender assembly
            from the vehicle. Release the clip and tabs (x2) to
            remove the LH side repeater. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Press to release the clip. Remove the frunk fender clips (x3)
            from the LH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Replace any damaged clip. Release the clips (x2) to remove the
            headlamp rubber grommet from the LH front fender.

title: Door - Front - LH (Remove and Install)

procedures.content:
Open the LH front door and
                        lower the LH front window.
Remove the driver footwell hush panel. See Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace) .

Remove the LH lower A-pillar
                        trim. See A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace) .

Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) .

Disconnect the J7 front door
                        connector.

Release the grommet and remove the LH front door harness from the A-pillar
                        area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Push the harness through the bulkhead from the A-pillar area.
Apply tape to the LH front fender area.

Apply tape surrounding the
                        hinges to mark the installation position.

Remove the bolt that
                        attaches the LH front door check strap to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket

Release the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges
                        to the door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm

With assistance, lift the LH
                        front door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded
                        surface.

specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body

Nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the
              door

llm_summary_text:
Open the LH front door and
                        lower the LH front window. Remove the driver footwell hush panel. See Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH lower A-pillar
                        trim. See A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Disconnect the J7 front door
                        connector. Release the grommet and remove the LH front door harness from the A-pillar
                        area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Push the harness through the bulkhead from the A-pillar area. Apply tape to the LH front fender area. Apply tape surrounding the
                        hinges to mark the installation position. Remove the bolt that
                        attaches the LH front door check strap to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket Release the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges
                        to the door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm With assistance, lift the LH
                        front door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded
                        surface.

title: Door - Front - LH (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content:
Open the LH front door and lower the
            LH front window.
Move the LH front seat backward.

Remove the secondary seal from the LH
            front door. See Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace) .
Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) .
Remove the LH exterior mirror. See Exterior Mirror - LH (Remove and Replace) .

Remove the LH front pressure sensor.
            See Door Pressure Sensor (Remove and Replace) .

Disconnect the LH front regulator
            motor connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Disengage the red locking tab, and
              then press down the black tab to release the connector.

Remove the LH front door speaker
            woofer. See Speaker - Front Door (Remove and Replace) .

Remove the LH front door closeout
            panel assembly. See Closeout Panel - Window Regulator - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to remove the window
              regulator from the door closeout panel assembly.

Remove the LH front outer door handle.
            See Door Handle Outer - Passive - LH - Front (Remove and Install) .
Remove the LH front door latch. See Door Latch - Front - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH front door harness. See Harness - Front LH Door - Premium - LHD (Remove and Replace) .
Apply tape to LH front fender.

Remove the LH front door check strap.
            See Check Strap - Front (Remove and Replace) .

Apply tape surrounding the hinges to
            mark the installation position.

Release the nuts (x2) that attach the
            LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm

With assistance, lift the LH front
            door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface.

specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body

Nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the
              door

llm_summary_text:
Open the LH front door and lower the
            LH front window. Move the LH front seat backward. Remove the secondary seal from the LH
            front door. See Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Remove the LH exterior mirror. See Exterior Mirror - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH front pressure sensor.
            See Door Pressure Sensor (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LH front regulator
            motor connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Disengage the red locking tab, and
              then press down the black tab to release the connector. Remove the LH front door speaker
            woofer. See Speaker - Front Door (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH front door closeout
            panel assembly. See Closeout Panel - Window Regulator - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to remove the window
              regulator from the door closeout panel assembly. Remove the LH front outer door handle.
            See Door Handle Outer - Passive - LH - Front (Remove and Install) . Remove the LH front door latch. See Door Latch - Front - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH front door harness. See Harness - Front LH Door - Premium - LHD (Remove and Replace) . Apply tape to LH front fender. Remove the LH front door check strap.
            See Check Strap - Front (Remove and Replace) . Apply tape surrounding the hinges to
            mark the installation position. Release the nuts (x2) that attach the
            LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm With assistance, lift the LH front
            door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface.

title: Hood (Remove and Install)

procedures.content:
Remove hood striker from
                        hood assembly. See Hood Striker (Remove and Replace) .

Remove LH and RH hood bump
                        stops from hood.
Remove hood baffle.
Apply tape surrounding hood hinge to keep accurate alignment.

With assistance, remove the nuts (x4) that attach the hood to the LH and RH
                        hood hinges. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

With assistance, remove the hood from the vehicle, and then place it on a
                        padded surface.

specifications.description: Nuts (x4) that secure hood to LH and RH hood hinges

llm_summary_text:
Remove hood striker from
                        hood assembly. See Hood Striker (Remove and Replace) . Remove LH and RH hood bump
                        stops from hood. Remove hood baffle. Apply tape surrounding hood hinge to keep accurate alignment. With assistance, remove the nuts (x4) that attach the hood to the LH and RH
                        hood hinges. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket With assistance, remove the hood from the vehicle, and then place it on a
                        padded surface.

title: Launcher Bracket - LH (LHD) (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content: Remove the wiper module. See Wiper Module - LHD (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH pedestrian protection actuator. See Actuator - Pedestrian Protection - Active Hood - LH (Remove and Replace) .

Remove the bolts (x2) that
                        attach the LH launcher bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

Remove the LH launcher
                        bracket from the vehicle.

specifications.description: Bolts (x2) that attach the launcher bracket to the body

llm_summary_text:
Remove the wiper module. See Wiper Module - LHD (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH pedestrian protection actuator. See Actuator - Pedestrian Protection - Active Hood - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the bolts (x2) that
                        attach the LH launcher bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Remove the LH launcher
                        bracket from the vehicle.

title: Liftgate (Remove and Install)

procedures.content: Open the liftgate.
Use a telescoping hood prop to support the liftgate.

Remove the rear headliner.
                        See Rear Headliner (Remove and Replace) .

Carefully release the clip
                        and location pin that attach the RH rear edge of the headliner to the
                        vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note This is to gain access to the liftgate harness connectors.

Remove and discard the bolt
                        that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket
Disconnect the liftgate harness connectors (x3).

Release the RH rear liftgate
                        grommet from the body.

Apply masking tape around the liftgate and liftgate hinge to mark the
                        installation positioning.

Place shop towels on the LH
                        and RH side liftgate jambs.

Release the spring clips
                        (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate,
                        and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 1. LH shown, RH similar

Remove the telescoping hood
                        prop.

With assistance, remove the
                        bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the
                        liftgate on a stand. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

specifications.description:
Bolt that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the
              liftgate
Bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle

llm_summary_text:
Open the liftgate. Use a telescoping hood prop to support the liftgate. Remove the rear headliner.
                        See Rear Headliner (Remove and Replace) . Carefully release the clip
                        and location pin that attach the RH rear edge of the headliner to the
                        vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note This is to gain access to the liftgate harness connectors. Remove and discard the bolt
                        that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Disconnect the liftgate harness connectors (x3). Release the RH rear liftgate
                        grommet from the body. Apply masking tape around the liftgate and liftgate hinge to mark the
                        installation positioning. Place shop towels on the LH
                        and RH side liftgate jambs. Release the spring clips
                        (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate,
                        and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 1. LH shown, RH similar Remove the telescoping hood
                        prop. With assistance, remove the
                        bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the
                        liftgate on a stand. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

title: Liftgate (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content:
Open the LH front door and
                        lower the LH front window.
Open the liftgate.

Remove the LH and RH
                        liftgate lower bump stops. See .
Remove the LH and RH liftgate wedge dampers. See Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH and RH bumper blocks. See Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH and RH lower liftgate plugs. Figure 1. LH Shown, RH Similar
Remove the liftgate harness and the harness grommet. See Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace) .
Disconnect the backlite glass heater negative connector.

Remove the clip and bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate
                        assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket
Remove the liftgate cinch latch. See Liftgate Cinch Latch (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the tuned mass damper. See Tuned Mass Damper (Remove and Replace) .

Remove the nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket
Remove the spoiler outer panel. See Spoiler Outer Panel (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the tail lamp. See Tail Lamp - Liftgate (Remove and Install) .
Disconnect the liftgate handle switch connector.

Remove the harness liftgate
                        extend from the liftgate assembly.

Remove the backlight glass.
                        See Backlite Glass (Remove and Install) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to remove the center high mounted brake light from the
                            backlight glass.

Use a telescoping hood prop
                        to support the liftgate.

Place shop towels on the LH
                        and RH side liftgate jambs.

Release the spring clips
                        (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate,
                        and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 2. LH Shown, RH Similar

Remove the telescoping hood
                        prop. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Assistance is recommended after removal.

With assistance, remove the
                        bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the
                        liftgate on a stand. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

Remove the LH and RH
                        liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) from the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Figure 3. LH Shown, RH Similar
Remove and discard all spacer pads.

Clean all remaining glass adhesive and spacer pads adhesive from the body
                        and the glass.

specifications.description:
Bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate
              assembly
Nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate
Bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle
LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2)

llm_summary_text:
Open the LH front door and
                        lower the LH front window. Open the liftgate. Remove the LH and RH
                        liftgate lower bump stops. See . Remove the LH and RH liftgate wedge dampers. See Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH and RH bumper blocks. See Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH and RH lower liftgate plugs. Figure 1. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove the liftgate harness and the harness grommet. See Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the backlite glass heater negative connector. Remove the clip and bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate
                        assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the liftgate cinch latch. See Liftgate Cinch Latch (Remove and Replace) . Remove the tuned mass damper. See Tuned Mass Damper (Remove and Replace) . Remove the nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the spoiler outer panel. See Spoiler Outer Panel (Remove and Replace) . Remove the tail lamp. See Tail Lamp - Liftgate (Remove and Install) . Disconnect the liftgate handle switch connector. Remove the harness liftgate
                        extend from the liftgate assembly. Remove the backlight glass.
                        See Backlite Glass (Remove and Install) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to remove the center high mounted brake light from the
                            backlight glass. Use a telescoping hood prop
                        to support the liftgate. Place shop towels on the LH
                        and RH side liftgate jambs. Release the spring clips
                        (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate,
                        and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 2. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove the telescoping hood
                        prop. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Assistance is recommended after removal. With assistance, remove the
                        bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the
                        liftgate on a stand. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Remove the LH and RH
                        liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) from the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Figure 3. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove and discard all spacer pads. Clean all remaining glass adhesive and spacer pads adhesive from the body
                        and the glass.

title: Lower Trunk (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content:
Remove the trunk sill trim.
                        See Trunk Sill Lower Trim (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH and RH load floor brackets. See Bracket - Load Floor - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace) .
Remove bottom foam pad from lower trunk.

Remove rear center bolt from
                        lower trunk assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

Remove lower trunk assembly from vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

specifications.description: Rear center bolt
Bolts (x4) attach lower trunk assembly to vehicle

llm_summary_text:
Remove the trunk sill trim.
                        See Trunk Sill Lower Trim (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH and RH load floor brackets. See Bracket - Load Floor - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace) . Remove bottom foam pad from lower trunk. Remove rear center bolt from
                        lower trunk assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Remove lower trunk assembly from vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket

title: Panel - Rear End (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content:
Place the vehicle on the 2-post
            lift. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Ensure the vehicle is
              not charging.
Remove both rear fender garnishes. See Fender Garnish - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace) .

Remove and discard the rear center
            bolt from the lower trunk assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

Remove the rear side bolts (x2) from the lower trunk assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket
Remove the rear fascia and diffuser assembly. See Assembly - Fascia and Diffuser - Rear (Remove and Install) .

Remove rear bumper beam from the
            vehicle. See Rear Bumper Beam (Remove and Replace)

Remove rear fascia center bracket from
            the vehicle. See Bracket - Center - Rear Fascia (Remove and Replace)

Remove liftgate striker from the
            vehicle. See Striker - Liftgate (Remove and Replace)

Remove bolts (x2) that attach the rear
            end panel to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket

Slide outward to remove the rear end
            panel from the rear of the vehicle.

specifications.description: Bolts (x2) that attach the rear end panel to the body
Lower trunk assembly rear center bolt
Lower trunk assembly rear side bolts (x2)

llm_summary_text:
Place the vehicle on the 2-post
            lift. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Ensure the vehicle is
              not charging. Remove both rear fender garnishes. See Fender Garnish - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the trunk tub. See Trunk Tub (Remove and Replace) . Remove and discard the rear center
            bolt from the lower trunk assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Remove the rear side bolts (x2) from the lower trunk assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Remove the rear fascia and diffuser assembly. See Assembly - Fascia and Diffuser - Rear (Remove and Install) . Remove rear bumper beam from the
            vehicle. See Rear Bumper Beam (Remove and Replace) Remove rear fascia center bracket from
            the vehicle. See Bracket - Center - Rear Fascia (Remove and Replace) Remove liftgate striker from the
            vehicle. See Striker - Liftgate (Remove and Replace) Remove bolts (x2) that attach the rear
            end panel to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Slide outward to remove the rear end
            panel from the rear of the vehicle.

title: Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content: Remove the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) .

Remove the bolts (x2) that attaches
            the LH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then remove the brace from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

specifications.description:
Bolts (x2) that attaches the LH/RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the
              body

llm_summary_text:
Remove the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) . Remove the bolts (x2) that attaches
            the LH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then remove the brace from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

title: Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content: Remove the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) .

Remove the bolts (x2) that attaches
            the RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then remove the brace from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

specifications.description:
Bolts (x2) that attaches the LH/RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the
              body

llm_summary_text:
Remove the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) . Remove the bolts (x2) that attaches
            the RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then remove the brace from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

title: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Install)

procedures.content: Open the LH doors and lower the LH windows.

Place the vehicle in
                        Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode .

Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) .

Release the grommet between the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2)
                        that attach the electrical harness connector to the door to disconnect the
                        harness from the B-pillar area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Release the top clip at first, and then while pressing the top one,
                            release the bottom clip.

Use tape to mark the position of the LH rear door hinges and the LH rear
                        door check strap. Figure 1. Check Strap Area as Example

Remove the bolt that
                        attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Unbolting the door
                            check allows the door to swing freely beyond opening limits. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket 4 in extension

With assistance, loosen the
                        bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then
                        fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

With assistance, remove the LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and
                        place it on a padded surface.

specifications.description: Bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body
Bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges

llm_summary_text:
Open the LH doors and lower the LH windows. Place the vehicle in
                        Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode . Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Release the grommet between the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2)
                        that attach the electrical harness connector to the door to disconnect the
                        harness from the B-pillar area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Release the top clip at first, and then while pressing the top one,
                            release the bottom clip. Use tape to mark the position of the LH rear door hinges and the LH rear
                        door check strap. Figure 1. Check Strap Area as Example Remove the bolt that
                        attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Unbolting the door
                            check allows the door to swing freely beyond opening limits. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket 4 in extension With assistance, loosen the
                        bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then
                        fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket With assistance, remove the LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and
                        place it on a padded surface.

title: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)

procedures.content:
Place the vehicle in
                        Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode .

Remove the HEPA filter
                        assembly. See HEPA Filter Assembly (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH rear door outer belt. See Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH rear door trim panel. See Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install) .
Remove the LH rear door window glass. See Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) .

Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) .

Disconnect the electrical
                        harness from the LH rear window motor.

Disconnect the electrical
                        harness from the LH rear door pressure sensor.

Release the clip that
                        attaches the manual latch release cable to the LH rear window closeout
                        assembly.

Release the clips (x3) that
                        attach the LH rear door harness to the LH rear window closeout
                        assembly.

Remove the plugs (x2) that
                        cover the LH rear window closeout assembly rail fasteners.

Remove the screws (x2) that
                        attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket

Remove the bolts (x11) that
                        attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door, and then
                        gently lift the closeout assembly upwards to release the datums and angle
                        the bottom of the assembly from the door. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Never
                            loosen or remove the nuts (x4) that attach the regulator arms to the
                            assembly closeout panel. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 8 mm socket
Disconnect the LH rear outer door handle connector.

Disconnect the LH rear door
                        electrical harness from the LH rear door latch connector.
Release the harness clips (x7) from the LH rear door.

Release the grommet between
                        the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2) that attach the electrical
                        harness connector to the door to disconnect the harness from the B-pillar
                        area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Release the top clip at
                            first, and then while pressing the top one, release the bottom
                            clip.
Remove the rubber grommet from the LH rear door assembly.
Remove the clip bases (x10) from the LH rear door.
Remove the LH rear door latch. See Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH rear outer door handle. See Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) .
Remove the LH rear door check strap. See Check Strap - Rear (Remove and Replace) .

With assistance, loosen the
                        bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then
                        fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket

With assistance, remove the
                        LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and place it on a padded
                        surface.

specifications.description:
Screws (x2) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the
              LH rear door

Bolts (x11) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear
              door
Bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges
Bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks

Place the vehicle in
                        Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode . Remove the HEPA filter
                        assembly. See HEPA Filter Assembly (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH rear door outer belt. See Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH rear door trim panel. See Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install) . Remove the LH rear door window glass. See Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Disconnect the electrical

                        assembly. Release the clips (x3) that

                        assembly. Remove the plugs (x2) that

          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the bolts (x11) that
                        attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door, and then
                        gently lift the closeout assembly upwards to release the datums and angle
                        the bottom of the assembly from the door. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Never
                            loosen or remove the nuts (x4) that attach the regulator arms to the
                            assembly closeout panel. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 8 mm socket Disconnect the LH rear outer door handle connector. Disconnect the LH rear door
                        electrical harness from the LH rear door latch connector. Release the harness clips (x7) from the LH rear door. Release the grommet between
                        the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2) that attach the electrical
                        harness connector to the door to disconnect the harness from the B-pillar
                        area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Release the top clip at
                            first, and then while pressing the top one, release the bottom
                            clip. Remove the rubber grommet from the LH rear door assembly. Remove the clip bases (x10) from the LH rear door. Remove the LH rear door latch. See Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH rear outer door handle. See Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH rear door check strap. See Check Strap - Rear (Remove and Replace) . With assistance, loosen the
                        bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then
                        fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket With assistance, remove the
                        LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and place it on a padded
                        surface.
